lead_paragraph: The Zions Bancorporation said yesterday that it would buy Sumitomo Bank Ltd.'s California bank for about $546 million in cash to expand into the state's growing Asian immigrant banking market. Zions, of Salt Lake City, will pay Sumitomo $32.26 a share for its 85 percent stake in Sumitomo Bank of California, which is based in San Francisco. Public shareholders will get $38.25 a share, which is 24 percent below the shares' price of $50.50 at the close of trading yesterday.
abstract: Zions Bancorporation will buy Sumitomo Bank Ltd's California bank for about $546 million in cash to expand into state's growing Asian immigrant banking market (S)

headline.main: Zions to Buy Sumitomo California Bank
